title: Stock Market Week Ahead: Tesla, Alphabet, GE Vernova And Defense Stocks
summary: Defense stocks, fast moving foreign banks, Tesla, Alphabet and others will be in focus for stock market investors in the coming week.

title: Dow Jones Futures: Tesla, Google Step Up With Earnings Due; AI Stock Breaks Out As Nvidia, AMD Run
summary: The stock market is at highs thanks to Nvidia and AMD, but getting a little stretched. Tesla and Google are on tap.

title: Tesla faces bumpy ride in H2, but real story is autonomy, robots: DB
summary: Investing.com -- Tesla’s second-quarter deliveries topped Deutsche Bank’s forecast thanks to stronger-than-expected results in the US and overseas, but Deutsche Bank analysts remain cautious on volumes and margins for the rest of 2025—even as they double down on the long-term promise of autonomous driving and humanoid robotics as Tesla’s true growth engine.

title: Tesla reportedly puts IT executive in charge of North American sales
summary: Investing.com -- Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) has appointed Raj Jegannathan, a senior information technology executive, in charge of its sales team as the electric vehicle maker faces declining demand, according to a Reuters report late Friday.

title: Stock Market Today: Stocks Fall As Google, Tesla Earnings Loom; Netflix Dives On Results (Live Coverage)
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average pared its losses but couldn't get out of negative ground Friday as tariff concerns resurfaced with President Donald Trump reportedly pushing for steeper levies from the European Union.  Decliners on the stock market today included American Express while Google-parent Alphabet managed some gains.  The blue-chip index had stumbled by more than 200 points earlier after the Financial Times reported that Trump wants a minimum tariff of 15% to 20% on EU goods brought into U.S. The report, citing unnamed sources, said a 10% tariff on most items had been part of discussions regarding a framework trade agreement.

title: Tesla Stock Heads for Weekly Gain. Why This China Graphite Tariff Could Affect EV Prices.
summary: Tesla  stock rose Friday as investors weighed new import duties on material for electric-vehicle batteries from China and a legal settlement regarding its self-driving technology.  Shares of the car company led by CEO Elon Musk rose 3.2% to $329.65 on Friday, while the  finished flat and the  dropped were up 0.3%.  One thing that helped was a recent legal settlement over a 2019 accident where a Tesla Model 3 with the company’s driver assistance features engaged allegedly failed to avoid a collision in Florida.

title: Exclusive-Tesla IT exec with no traditional car-sales experience is running sales, sources say
summary: (Reuters) -A relatively little-known information technology executive is running Tesla's sales team as the electric carmaker grapples with a drop in sales, according to people familiar with the matter.  Raj Jegannathan, a senior executive with a wide purview including several IT and data functions, recently took over the sales role, said the people familiar with the matter.  Jegannathan, who has recently grown closer to CEO Elon Musk, has no traditional sales experience, according to two people familiar with the matter and his LinkedIn profile.
